description: Using a diverse set of tools, researchers show how the pandemic did -- or didn't -- affect fine particulate matter concentrations during COVID lockdowns.
title: Pandemic air quality due to weather, not just lockdowns, study finds
content: Headlines proclaiming Covid lockdowns drastically reduced pollution were mostly referring to nitrogen dioxide, NO2, a reactive gas emitted from burning fuel. There had been less understanding of how … [+5470 chars]

author: CBC News
description: A recent study by Dalhousie University's head of wheelchair research says occupational therapists in the province aren't feeling prepared when it comes to offering training for wheelchair skills.
title: Advocates say more wheelchair training needed for N.S. occupational therapists
content:
Andrew Jantzen uses a wheelchair to get around, but he's never received adequate training on how to use it.
